page.title: 04ST. MARY'S CHURCH II
page.content: ST. MARY'S CHURCH II ......because people still thought Jane was a witch.They started off with five bells in the church,but now they have six bells.On the walls outside the church there are grooves where people sharpened their arrows to practice shooting incase the Vikings and the Danes attacked.There were seven Earl Cowpers.They owned much of Hertford,Tewin and Digswell.They lived in Panshanger house.In the churchyard four of the seven Earls are buried in a family,two others were nearby and the seventh was buried in the church.Earl Cowper gave a donation for our school to be built for the village children.The first Rector in the church dates from about 1239,so the church was probably built sometime in the thirteenth century.In 1890 the church was starting to crumble away.>>
